hint.text: Cost of painting \(=\) Surface area \(\times\) Rate of painting

solution.text:
Cost of painting inner surface area\(=\,\)Rs.\(_{{trunc((2*pi_val*j**2*l),2)}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Surface area \(\times\) Rate \(=_{{trunc((2*pi_val*j**2*l),2)}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow 2 \pi r_i^2 \times _{l}_=_{{trunc((2*pi_val*j**2*l),2)}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow r_i^2=\frac{_{{trunc((2*pi_val*j**2*l),2)}}_}{2 \pi \times _{l}_}=_{{j**2}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow r_i=_{j}_\,m\)
The inner radius of the dome is \(_{j}_\,m\)

content.text:
A dome of a building is in the form of a hemisphere. The cost of painting the inner surface area and the outer surface area is Rs.\(_{{trunc((2*pi_val*j**2*l),2)}}_\) and Rs.\(_{{trunc((2*pi_val*(j+2)**2*l),2)}}_\) respectively. If the cost of painting is Rs.\(_{l}_\) per sq.m.,
find the inner radius of the dome.
